page.title: 07THE VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The Village Hall was built by Public Subscription in 1892. The hall was given to the village on a 99 year lease by Sir Hary Vernon of {Hanbury {Hall.}Trustees were appointed to look after the hall and the management committee was made up of a member of each organization using the hall. In the past as many as seventeen clubs and organizations used the hall for their meetings and events. The hall was also used for Village dances and cocerts. At times of local and national elections the hall becomes a polling station for the village and surrounding district. The Village hall remains an important part of village life. It is used by the local Womens Institute, Playgroup, for whist drives and Church events such as the Harvest Supper and Christmas Fair.
